CHAPTER ONE]91-blue - eyed devil

[I]0-i first saw [him]246-he at [[my]0-i brother]247-my brother ’s wedding , at [the back of [the reception tent]249-the reception tent]248-the back of the reception tent . [He]246-he stood with [the insolent , loose - jointed slouch of someone who 'd rather spend [his]246-he time in [a pool hall]251-a pool hall]250-the insolent , loose - jointed slouch of someone who 'd rather spend his time in a pool hall . Although [he]246-he was well dressed , it was obvious [he]246-he did n't make [his]246-he living sitting behind a desk . No amount of Armani tailoring could soften [that build — big framed and rugged — like a roughneck or a bull rider]252-that build — big framed and rugged — like a roughneck or a bull rider . [His]246-he long fingers , clasped gently around a champagne flute , could have snapped the crystal stem with ease .

[I]0-i knew from a glance that [he]246-he was [a good ol' boy , able to hunt , play football and poker , and hold]253-a good ol' boy , able to hunt , play football and poker , and hold [his]246-he liquor . Not [my]0-i type . [I]0-i was interested in something more .

Even so , [he]246-he was [a compelling figure]254-a compelling figure . [He]246-he was good - looking , handsome if [you]255-you overlooked the crook in a nose that had once been broken . [His]246-he dark brown hair , as thick and lustrous as mink fur , was cut in short layers . But it was the eyes that seized [my]0-i attention , blue even at a distance , a volatile color [you]255-you could never forget once [you]255-you 'd seen it . It gave [me]0-i a little shock when [his]246-he head mined and [he]246-he stared right at [me]0-i .

[I]0-i turned away immediately , embarrassed to have been caught staring . But awareness continued to spread over [my]0-i skin , a heat so insistent that [I]0-i knew [he]246-he was still looking . [I]0-i drank [my]0-i champagne in fast swallows , letting the arid fizz soothe [my]0-i nerves . Only then did [I]0-i risk another glance .

[Those]246-he blue eyes glinted with an uncivilized suggestion . A faint smile was tucked in one corner of [his]246-he wide mouth . Definitely would n't want to be alone in [a room]256-a room with [that guy]257-that guy , [I]0-i thought . [His]246-he gaze moved downward in a lazy inspection , returned to [my]0-i face , and [he]246-he gave [me]0-i one of those respectful nods that [Texan men]258-texan men had raised to an art form .

[I]0-i deliberately turned away , giving full attention to [[my]0-i boyfriend]259-my boyfriend , [Nick]92-nick . [His]246-he arm slid around [me]0-i . " [We]260-we 'll see what [[your]0-i father]2082-your father has to say about it . "[246-he]

[Nick]92-nick was going to ask [Dad]93-dad for permission to marry [me]0-i , a tradition [I]0-i thought was old - fashioned and unnecessary . But [[my]0-i boyfriend]259-my boyfriend was being stubborn .

" [You]0-i 're the best thing that 's ever happened to [me]0-i . "[0-i] [I]0-i snuggled into the familiar crook of [Nick]92-nick 's arm . [[My]0-i brother]247-my brother [Gage]94-gage had insisted on a small wedding ceremony . [Only handful of [people]268-people]267-only handful of people had been allowed inside [the tiny [Houston]1-houston chapel , which had once been used by [Spanish settlers]270-spanish settlers in [the seven - teen hundreds]271-the seven - teen hundreds]269-the tiny houston chapel , which had once been used by spanish settlers in the seven - teen hundreds . The reception , by contrast , was a circus .

"[287-a renowned wedding planner]

As [all creation]288-all creation knew , it was a big checkbook .

[[My]0-i father]280-my father , [Churchill Travis]95-churchill , was [a famous " market wizard]2083-a famous " market wizard , "[2083-a famous " market wizard] having created [an international energy index fund that had nearly doubled in [its]290-an international energy index fund that had nearly doubled in its first decade first decade]290-an international energy index fund that had nearly doubled in its first decade . And then [he]93-dad would give a sneaky laugh , because [he]93-dad always thought [he]93-dad deserved more than [he]93-dad deserved .

[Seven hundred guests]310-seven hundred guests had been invited to the reception , but at least [a thousand]311-a thousand had shown up . [People]268-people milled inside [the mansion]313-the mansion and out to the enormous white tent , which was webbed with millions of tiny white fairy lights and blanketed with white and pink orchids . The humid warmth of the spring evening brought out the pillowy - sweet fragrance of the flowers .

Inside [the air - conditioned house]314-the air - conditioned house , [a main buffet room]315-a main buffet room was divided by [a thirty - two - foot long ice bar laden with all kinds of shellfish]316-a thirty - two - foot long ice bar laden with all kinds of shellfish .

There were twelve ice sculptures , one of them formed around a champagne fountain , another featuring a vodka fountain studded with pockets of caviar . [White - gloved waiters]317-white - gloved waiters filled frosted crystal cylinders with biting - cold vodka , and ladled caviar onto tiny sour cream blinis and pickled quail eggs .

The hot buffet tables featured tureens of lobster bisque , chafing dishes filled with slices of pecan - smoked tenderloin , grilled ahi tuna , and at least thirty other entrees . [I]0-i 'd been to many parties and events in [Houston]1-houston , but [I]0-i had never seen so much food in one place in [my]0-i life .

Reporters from the [Houston]1-houston Chronicle and [Texas]3-texas Monthly were there to cover the reception , which included guests like [the former governor and mayor]318-the former governor and mayor , [a famous TV chef]319-a famous tv chef , [Hollywood people]320-hollywood people , and [oil people]321-oil people . [Everyone]322-everyone was waiting for [Gage]94-gage and [Liberty]102-liberty , who had stayed behind at [the chapel]323-the chapel with [the photographer]324-the photographer .

[Nick]92-nick was a little dazed . Coming from a respectable middle - class background , this was a shock to [his]325-his system . CHAPTER THREE

Contrary to [my]0-i expections of elopement as a furtive Elvis - supervised ceremony in [Las Vegas]43-las vegas , there were hotels in [Florida]44-florida , [Hawaii]38-hawaii , and [Arizona]45-arizona that offered " elopement packages "[92-nick] including the wedding service , the hotel stay , massages , and a meal plan . " [[Your]0-i dad]2098-your dad will have to start doing things for [us]707-we when [we]707-we have [kids]2211-kids , "[92-nick] [Nick]92-nick told [me]0-i . " [Nick]92-nick — "[0-i] Panicky and confused , [I]0-i watched [him]729-he walk to [the bed room]730-the bed room . [My]0-i cheeks looked white and stiff . [I]0-i brushed on some pink blush in light strokes , but the tinted powder seemed to sit on top of [my]0-i skin , not blending . CHAPTER FOUR

Little by little [our]758-our marriage closed around [me]0-i . At first it seemed like heaven when [I]0-i stopped working . [I]0-i had all the time [I]0-i needed to make [the condo]624-the condo look perfect . [I]0-i vacuumed the carpet so the polyester nap was arranged in symmetrical stripes . Every square inch of [the kitchen]432-the kitchen was sparkling and clean . [I]0-i spent hours poring over recipes , improving [my]0-i cooking skills . [I]0-i arranged [Nick]92-nick 's socks in color - coordinated rows in the drawer .

Just before [Nick]92-nick came [home]348-home from [the office]762-the office , [I]0-i put on makeup and changed [my]0-i outfit . [I]0-i had started to do that after [he]763-he 'd told [me]0-i one night [he]763-he hoped [I]0-i was n't [one of [those women who let [themselves]765-those women who let themselves go after they 'd caught a husband go after [they]765-those women who let themselves go after they 'd caught a husband 'd caught [a husband]501-a husband]765-those women who let themselves go after they 'd caught a husband]764-one of those women who let themselves go after they 'd caught a husband .

If [Nick]92-nick had been [a jerk]767-a jerk all the time , [I]0-i would n't have been so compliant . It was the in - between moments that kept [me]0-i with [him]763-he , the evenings when [we]768-we cuddled in front of the TV and watched the news , the impromptu slow dance after dinner when [our]768-we favorite song came on . [He]763-he could [he]763-he affectionate and funny . [He]763-he could be loving . And [he]763-he was [the first person in [my]0-i life who had ever needed [me]0-i]769-the first person in my life who had ever needed me . [I]0-i was [[his]763-he audience]770-his audience , [his]763-he reflection , [his]763-he solace , [the person without whom [he]763-he could never be complete]771-the person without whom he could never be complete . [He]763-he had found [my]0-i worst weakness : [I]0-i was [one of [those people who was desperate to be needed]773-those people who was desperate to be needed , to matter to [someone]263-someone]772-one of those people who was desperate to be needed , to matter to someone .

There was a lot about [our]775-our relationship that worked . The part that [I]0-i had a hard time dealing with was the constant sense of being off balance . [The men in [my]0-i life]776-the men in my life , [[my]0-i fathers]777-my fathers and [brothers]704-brothers , had always been predictable . [Nick]92-nick , however , reacted differently at different times to the same behavior . [I]0-i was never certain when [I]0-i did something if it would be received with praise or displeasure . It made [me]0-i anxious , always hunting for clues about how [I]0-i should behave .

[Nick]92-nick remembered everything [I]0-i had ever told [him]763-he about [[my]0-i family]328-my family and childhood , but [he]763-he colored it all differently . [He]763-he told [me]0-i [I]0-i had never really been loved by [[anyone]414-anyone but [him]763-he]781-anyone but him . [He]763-he told [me]0-i what [I]0-i really thought , who [I]0-i really was , and [he]763-he was so authoritative on the subject of [me]0-i that [I]0-i began to doubt [my]0-i own perceptions . Especially when [he]763-he echoed the standard phrases from [my]0-i childhood . . . " [You]0-i need to get over it . "[763-he]

" [You]0-i 're overreacting . "[763-he]

" [You]0-i take everything too personally . "[416-my own mother] [[My]0-i own mother]416-my own mother had said those things to [me]0-i , and now [Nick]92-nick was saying them too .

[His]763-he temper exploded without warning when [I]0-i made the wrong sandwich for [his]763-he lunch , when [I]0-i 'd forgotten to run a particular errand . Since [I]0-i did n't have [a car]783-a car , [I]0-i had to walk or bike a quarter mile to [the grocery store]784-the grocery store , and [I]0-i did n't always have time to accomplish all [I]0-i needed to do . After [you]964-you ’ve been systematically abused , [your]964-you judgment erodes to the point where it 's nearly impossible to make decisions . Small decisions are as tough as big ones . [You]964-you are so scared about doing the wrong thing , being blamed and punished for it , [you]964-you 'd rather have [someone else]2115-someone else take the responsibility .

CHAPTER FIVE

In [Texas]3-texas there is an obligatory sixty - day waiting period after [you]1001-you file a petition for divorce . At some point [someone in [the state]1003-the state legislature]1002-someone in the state legislature had decided that a legally mandated cooling - off period was a good idea for [people who wanted a divorce]1004-people who wanted a divorce . [I]0-i 'd rather [they]1002-someone in the state legislature had left it up to [me]0-i to decide whether [I]0-i needed cooling off or not . Once the decision had been made , [I]0-i wanted to get it over with quickly .

On the other hand , [I]0-i made pretty good use of those two months . [I]0-i healed outwardly , the bruises fading , and [I]0-i started going twice a week to [a therapist]1005-a therapist . Having never been to [a therapist]1005-a therapist before , [I]0-i expected [I]0-i was going to have to lie back on a sofa and talk while [some impersonal white - coated professional]1007-some impersonal white - coated professional took notes .

[Her]1009-a therapist who did n't seem all that much older than me name was [Susan Byrnes]143-susan , and [she]1009-a therapist who did n't seem all that much older than me was dark - haired and bright - eyed and sociable . [She]1009-a therapist who did n't seem all that much older than me was understanding and smart , and as [I]0-i described things [I]0-i had felt and gone through , it seemed [she]1009-a therapist who did n't seem all that much older than me had the power to unlock the mysteries of the universe .

[Susan]143-susan said [Nick]92-nick 's behavior fit the pattern of [someone with narcissistic personality disorder]1010-someone with narcissistic personality disorder , which was common for [abusive husbands]1011-abusive husbands . [A person with NPD]1012-a person with npd was domineering , blaming , self - absorbed , intolerant of [others]1013-others ' needs . . . and [they]1012-a person with npd used rage as a control tactic . [They]1012-a person with npd did n't respect [anyone else]2224-anyone else 's boundaries , which meant [they]1012-a person with npd felt entitled to bully and criticize until [[their]1012-a person with npd victims]1015-their victims were an absolute mess . Having a personality disorder was different from being crazy , as [Susan]143-susan explained , because unlike [a crazy person]1016-a crazy person , [a narcissist]1017-a narcissist could control when and where [he]1017-a narcissist lost [his]1017-a narcissist temper . [He]1017-a narcissist 'd never beat up [[his]1017-a narcissist boss]787-his boss at work , for example , because that would be against [his]1017-a narcissist own interests . [I]143-susan was ready to learn from [her]150-vanessa , follow [her]150-vanessa example . [I]143-susan thought [she]150-vanessa was going to be a great new influence in [my]143-susan life . But in a matter of days , [I]143-susan realized [I]143-susan was being gaslighted . [I]143-susan was familiar with the tactic , since [Nick]92-nick had done if a lot . [A bully]2504-a bully or [someone with personality disorder]2505-someone with personality disorder needs to keep [[their]2505-someone with personality disorder victims]1015-their victims confused , off balance , perpetually unsure of [themselves]2505-someone with personality disorder . That way [he]2507-he or [she]2508-she could manipulate [you]2509-you more easily . Gaslighting could be anything that made [you]2509-you doubt [yourself]2509-you . For example , [a bully]2504-a bully would make a statement about something , and when [you]2509-you 'd agree with it , [he]2504-a bully 'd disagree with [his]2504-a bully own original statement . Or [he]2504-a bully 'd make [you]2509-you think [you]2509-you 'd lost something when [you]2509-you had n't , or accuse [you]2509-you of forgetting something when [he]2504-a bully 'd never asked [you]2509-you to do it in the first place . What worried [me]143-susan was that [I]143-susan seemed to be [[Vanessa]150-vanessa 's only target]2511-vanessa 's only target . [No one else]2512-no one else seemed to be having a problem with [her]150-vanessa . [She]150-vanessa would misplace a file and tell [me]143-susan to get it for [her]150-vanessa , turning up the tension until [I]143-susan was scrambling to find it . If [I]143-susan could n't come up with it , [she]150-vanessa accused [me]143-susan of hiding the file somewhere . And then the file would turn up in some weird place , like beneath a plant on top of a cabinet , or wedged between the printer cart and [her]150-vanessa desk . [She]150-vanessa gave [people]268-people the impression that [I]143-susan was scatterbrained and disorganized . And [I]143-susan had no proof of [her]150-vanessa mischief - making . The only thing that kept [me]143-susan from doubting [myself]143-susan was [my]143-susan own shaky sense of sanity . There was no predicting [Vanessa]150-vanessa 's moods or requests . [I]143-susan learned to save everything , after [she]150-vanessa asked [me]143-susan to write three different drafts of a letter and then decided on the first version after [I]143-susan 'd deleted it . And [I]0-i wondered how [you]1501-you could ever be sure , when [you]1501-you thought [you]1501-you loved [someone]263-someone , if [you]1501-you really did . The next day , it rained . During the occasional droughts , [Houston]1-houston got so dry that , as a local joke went , " the trees are bribing the dogs . "[263-someone] But when it rained , it rained . And as [a virtually flat city]1503-a virtually flat city built around bayous , [Houston]1-houston had major drainage issues . During a heavy downpour , water collected high in [the streets]1504-the streets and flowed into storm drains , culverts , and bayous that directed the flow to [the Gulf of Mexico]76-the gulf of mexico . In the past , [countless people]1505-countless people had been killed by flash flooding , [[their]1505-countless people cars]1506-their cars overturned or swept away as [they]1505-countless people tried to cross the rising water . Sometimes flooding ruptured fuel pipelines , sewer lines , knocked out [bridges]1507-bridges , and made [major roads]1508-major roads inaccessible . A flood watch was announced after lunchtime , and later it was changed to an actual warning . [Everyone]322-everyone took it in stride , since [[Houston]1-houston residents]1510-houston residents were accustomed to flash flooding and generally knew [which streets to avoid]1511-which streets to avoid during the evening commute . "People[124-hardy] do n't drown in [elevators]1539-elevators , " [I]2279-someone there said aloud . The water had reached [my]2279-someone there knees , and it was biting cold . [I]2279-someone there pulled [my]2279-someone there computer from [my]2279-someone there briefcase , opened it , and tried in vain to get any kind of Internet signal . [I]2279-someone there looked at the ceiling , which was covered in wood paneling and tiny recessed lights , all out . Was n't there supposed to be an escape hatch ? Maybe it was concealed . [I]2279-someone there could n't think of any way to get up there and search for it . [I]2279-someone there waded to the side of the door and tried the phone panel again , as well as all the buttons , and nothing happened . By the time [I]2279-someone there got tired of pounding , [I]2279-someone there was submerged up to [my]2279-someone there hips . [I]2279-someone there was so cold that [my]2279-someone there teeth were chattering and the bones in [my]2279-someone there legs were aching . Except for the water pouring in , everything was quiet . It was calm everywhere except inside [my]2279-someone there head . [I]2279-someone there realized [I]2279-someone there was in a coffin . [I]2279-someone there was actually going to die in this metal box . [I'd]2279-someone there heard it was n't supposed to be a bad way to die , drowning . There were worse ways to go . But it was so unfair — [I]2279-someone there had never done anything with [my]2279-someone there life that was worth putting in an obituary . [I]2279-someone there was certain that [people facing death]2949-people facing death should be occupied with noble thoughts , but instead [I]2279-someone there found [myself]2279-someone there thinking about those moments in [the stairwell]2880-the stairwell with [Hardy]124-hardy . AUTHOR 'S NOTEDear Friends , As [I]2069-i researched [Blue - Eyed Devil]91-blue - eyed devil and contemplated the personal journey of [[my]2069-i heroine]3548-my heroine [Haven Travis]103-haven , [I]2069-i became amazed by how widespread the issues of abuse and narcissistic personality disorder are , and how seldom they are discussed in the media . [I]2069-i think part of the problem is that [victims of verbal and emotional abuse]3549-victims of verbal and emotional abuse — which can occur at [home]348-home , in [the workplace]3551-the workplace , or in any kind of relationship — are so accustomed to what [they]3549-victims of verbal and emotional abuse think of as "[2069-i] normal " behavior , [they]3549-victims of verbal and emotional abuse are n't aware of what "[2069-i] normal " really is . [No person]2073-no person has the right to bully , slander , or control [someone else]2115-someone else . [No person]2073-no person has the right to diminish or harm [another person]2076-another person in any way . [I]0-i have found a few websites that [I]0-i think are very informative about abuse and personality disorders . They contain links , articles , and resources for anyone interested in finding out more about these problems.www.abusesanctuary.blogspot.comwww.controllingparents.comwww.narcissism.101.comThere is also [a National Domestic Violence Hotline]2077-a national domestic violence hotline , which has a website as well as a phone number.(800 ) 799 - SAFE www.ndvh.orgAlso , [I]0-i would like to encourage anyone who has long hair and is thinking of getting a short cut , like [Haven Travis]103-haven did , to check out the Locks of Love program .
